Pre-Game Insights: India are all set to take on one of their biggest rivals and defending champions, England in the second semi-final clash of the T20 World Cup 2024 at Guyana, on Thursday, June 27.
Rohit Sharma and Co. have remained unbeaten in the tournament so far, having defeated the likes of Australia and Pakistan en route.
England have managed to secure qualification despite losing against teams like South Africa and Australia.
The two teams had met in the semifinals of the last edition of the T20 World Cup as well, where England thrashed India by 10 wickets.
India and England have faced each other 23 times in T20 internationals, in which, the Men in Blue have had a marginally better record, winning 12 matches compared to England's 11 wins.
India will play England in second semi-final of the T20 World Cup 2024 on June 27, 2024, which will be hosted at the Providence Stadium in Guyana. The match is scheduled to start at 8 PM IST.
